guidance: Discard. TED translates at form-level. OCDS translates at field-level.
[Add a party](../operations#add-a-party), and add 'buyer' to its `.roles`\n\nSet `buyer.id` to its `.id` and `buyer.name` to its [`.name`](#/CONTRACTING_BODY/ADDRESS_CONTRACTING_BODY/OFFICIALNAME)
Take the NUTS code in the `CODE` attribute, and map to `.address.region`\n\nThere's an open issue ([#739](https://github.com/open-contracting/standard/issues/739)) about region codes. (ISSUE)

Take the country code in the `VALUE` attribute, translate to a country name, and map to `.address.countryName`\n\nThere's an open issue ([#524](https://github.com/open-contracting/standard/issues/524)) to add a `.countryCode` field to the `Address` object, to avoid translation. (ISSUE)
[Add a party](../operations#add-a-party), add 'buyer' to its `.roles`, and set its [fields as above](#/CONTRACTING_BODY/ADDRESS_CONTRACTING_BODY/OFFICIALNAME)

Discard. If there are multiple parties with the role 'buyer', then the contract involves joint procurement. (When *The contract involves joint procurement* is checked, at least one additional contracting authority is provided.)
Add 'centralPurchasingBody' to the `.roles` of the party (PROPOSAL #11)

Get the `Organization` object for the buyer, and add a `Classification` object to its `.details.classifications` array. Set the classification's `.scheme` to 'TED_CA_TYPE', and set its `.id` and/or `.name` as follows: (PROPOSAL #10)

Get the `Organization` object for the buyer, and add a `Classification` object to its `.details.classifications` array. Set the classification's `.scheme` to ['COFOG'](https://unstats.un.org/unsd/publications/catalogue?selectID=145), and set its `.id` and `.name` as follows: (PROPOSAL #10)

Get the `Organization` object for the buyer, and add a `Classification` object to its `.details.classifications` array. Set the classification's `.scheme` to 'TED_CE_ACTIVITY', and set its `.id` as follows: (PROPOSAL #10)\n\n*The codes are drawn from [Directive 2014/25/EU](https://eur-lex.europa.eu/legal-content/en/TXT/?uri=CELEX%3A32014L0025#L_2014094EN.01033901)*
Set `tender.classification.scheme` to 'CPV', take the CPV code in the `CODE` attribute, and map to `tender.classification.id` (PROPOSAL #15)
For each `CODE` attribute, add a `Classification` object to the `tender.additionalClassifications` array, set `.scheme` to 'CPVS', prefix by the *Main CPV code*, and map to `.id` (PROPOSAL #16)
If the contract is divided into lots, add a `Lot` object to the `tender.lots` array

For each `CODE` attribute, if not already added, add a `Classification` object to the `tender.additionalClassifications` array, set `.scheme` to 'CPV', and map to `.id`. If the contract is divided into lots, add the lot's `.id` to the classification's `.relatedLots`. (PROPOSAL #18)

For each `CODE` attribute, if not already added, add a `Classification` object to the `tender.additionalClassifications` array, set `.scheme` to 'CPVS', prefix by the *Main CPV code*, and map to `.id`. If the contract is divided into lots, add the lot's `.id` to the classification's `.relatedLots`. (PROPOSAL #18)

If the contract is divided into lots, map to the lot's `.description`.Â Otherwise, append to `tender.description`.\n\n*If the contract isn't divided into lots, this results in a loss of structure.* (WARNING)

If not already added, [add a party](../operations#add-a-party), add 'funder' to its `.roles`, and set its `.name` to 'European Union'.\n\nAdd a `Finance` object to the `planning.budget.finance` array, and set its `.financingParty.name` to 'European Union' and `.financingParty.id` to the party's `.id`. If a structured identifier is used to identify the project, map to `.id`; otherwise, set its `.id`, and map to `.title`. If the contract is divided into lots, set its `.relatedLot` to the lot's `.id`. (PROPOSAL #20)
Discard. If there's no party with the role 'funder' and the name 'European Union', then the procurement isn't related to a project and/or programme financed by European Union funds.
Take the NUTS code in the `CODE` attribute, and map to `.address.region`\n\nThere's an open issue ([#739](https://github.com/open-contracting/standard/issues/739)) about region codes. (ISSUE)

[Add a party](../operations#add-a-party), and add 'mediationBody' to its `.roles` (PROPOSAL #4)
